metadata.title: CVE-2023-35827 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.3.8. A use-after-freewas found in ravb_remove in drivers/net/ethernet/renesas/ravb_main.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1050-kvm - 5.15.0-1050.55
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1053-aws - 5.15.0-1053.58
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1006-azure - 5.15.0-1055.63
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-lowlatency - 5.15.0-94.104

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1051-oracle - 5.15.0-1051.57
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1027-oem - 6.1.0-1027.27
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1008-raspi - 5.15.0-1046.49

No subscription required

linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needs-triage').
